metadata.title: CVE-2018-16152 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In verify_emsa_pkcs1_signature() in gmp_rsa_public_key.c in the gmp pluginin strongSwan 4.x and 5.x before 5.7.0, the RSA implementation based on GMPdoes not reject excess data in the digestAlgorithm.parameters field duringPKCS#1 v1.5 signature verification. Consequently, a remote attacker canforge signatures when small public exponents are being used, which couldlead to impersonation when only an RSA signature is used for IKEv2authentication. This is a variant of CVE-2006-4790 and CVE-2014-1568.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16152` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

charon-cmd - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
charon-systemd - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
libcharon-standard-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
libstrongswan - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-charon - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-libcharon - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-nm - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-pki - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-scepclient - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-starter - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-swanctl - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-tnc-base - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-tnc-client - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-tnc-ifmap - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-tnc-pdp - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
strongswan-tnc-server - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: strongswan package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.2-1ubuntu2.2').
